alert.note: Alert for Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 9:30AM CDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mustinka River Near Wheaton affecting Traverse County. 12 Mile Creek near Wheaton affecting Traverse County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mustinka River Near Wheaton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 94.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CDT Monday was 94.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 92.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon by 530 PM CDT.
